The '''PlayStation VR2''' ('''PS VR2''') is a [[virtual reality headset]] for the [[PlayStation 5]] [[home video game consoles|home video game console]] developed by [[Sony Interactive Entertainment]] released on February 22, 2023.<ref name="Verge Preview">{{cite web| url = https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/14/23351946/playstation-vr-psvr-2-hands-on-impressions-horizon-call-of-the-mountain-sony| title = We finally got our hands and eyes on the PlayStation VR2| last1 = Peters| first1 = Jay| last2 = Song| first2 = Victoria| date = 14 September 2022| website = [[The Verge]]| publisher = [[Vox Media]]| access-date = 5 October 2022| quote = }}</ref><ref name="cnet hands on">{{cite web| url = https://www.cnet.com/tech/gaming/psvr-2-hands-on-why-the-upcoming-ps5-vr-headset-wowed-us/| title = PlayStation VR 2 Hands-On: Sony's Upcoming PS5 VR Headset Wowed Me| last = Stein| first = Scott| date = 16 September 2022| website = [[CNET]]| publisher = [[Red Ventures]]| access-date = 5 October 2022 | quote = }}</ref>

==History==
Development of PS VR2 took about six years, and was developed simultaneously alongside the PlayStation 5, with the goal to craft the perfect match of a console and a virtual reality device.<ref name=":5">{{Cite web |last=Zlatev |first=Daniel |title=Sony developed PSVR2 for a PlayStation 5 cable connection as it warns original VR games will be difficult to port |url=https://www.notebookcheck.net/Sony-developed-PSVR2-for-a-PlayStation-5-cable-connection-as-it-warns-original-VR-games-will-be-difficult-to-port.675751.0.html |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=Notebookcheck |language=en}}</ref>

Leading up to the PS VR2 release, a display analyst from the Display Supply Chain Consultants (DSCC), said that he expected the upcoming next generation VR headset to have a display with the highest pixel density on a commercial OLED panel, with pixel density "well above 800 PPI".<ref name=":6">{{Cite web |last=Zlatev |first=Daniel |title=Sony PlayStation VR2 to sport OLED display with a larger size and the highest pixel density |url=https://www.notebookcheck.net/Sony-PlayStation-VR2-to-sport-OLED-display-with-a-larger-size-and-the-highest-pixel-density.613370.0.html |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=Notebookcheck |language=en}}</ref>

At the 2022 [[Consumer Electronics Show]], Sony announced the PlayStation VR2 for the [[PlayStation 5]].<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|date=February 23, 2021|title=Introducing the next generation of VR on PlayStation|url=https://blog.playstation.com/2021/02/23/introducing-the-next-generation-of-vr-on-playstation/|access-date=October 5, 2022|website=PlayStation.Blog|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":8">{{cite web | url = https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-vr2-detailed-horizon-call-of-the-mountain-announced/1100-6499345/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f | title = PlayStation VR2 Detailed, Horizon: Call Of The Mountain Announced | first=  Tamoor | last=  Hussain |date = January 4, 2022 | accessdate  = October 5, 2022 | work = [[GameSpot]] }}</ref>

A release date of February 22, 2023, and a retail price of $549.99 was announced on November 2, 2022 at the official ''[[PlayStation Blog]]''.<ref name=":9">{{Cite web |date=2022-11-02 |title=PlayStation VR2 launches in February at $549.99 |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2022/11/02/playstation-vr2-launches-in-february-at-549-99/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref>

Prior to release, [[Bloomberg News|''Bloomberg'']] reported that Sony reduced its projections for the initial launch after early pre-orders disappointed.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-01-31 |title=Sony Slashes PlayStation VR2 Headset Output After Pre-Orders Disappoint |language=en |work=Bloomberg.com |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-01-31/sony-playstation-vr2-headset-pre-order-disappointment-leads-to-production-cut |access-date=2023-02-16}}</ref> Sony instead claimed that it did "not cut ... production numbers", and told ''[[GamesIndustry.biz]]'' that it is "seeing enthusiasm from PlayStation fans for the upcoming launch".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-31 |title=Sony: We have not cut PSVR 2 production numbers |url=https://www.gamesindustry.biz/sony-we-have-not-cut-ps-vr-2-production-numbers |access-date=2023-02-16 |website=GamesIndustry.biz |language=en}}</ref>

==Hardware==
The headset connects to the PlayStation 5 console through a single [[USB-C]] cable, which enables a simple [[plug and play]] design.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=2023-02-06 |title=PlayStation VR2: The ultimate FAQ |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2023/02/06/playstation-vr2-the-ultimate-faq/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-02-19 |title=PSVR2 review - a VR enthusiast's dream |language=en-gb |work=Eurogamer.net |url=https://www.eurogamer.net/psvr2-review-a-vr-enthusiasts-dream#comments |access-date=2023-02-19}}</ref> The cable length is 4.5 m (14.7 ft).<ref name=":0" /> Sony stated that while they are still researching the technical possibility of a wireless connection, due to concerns about its impact on performance, they chose to go with the cable solution.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bezmalinovic |first=Tomislav |date=2022-12-27 |title=Playstation VR: Sony researches wireless virtual reality |url=https://mixed-news.com/en/playstation-vr-sony-researches-wireless-virtual-reality/ |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=MIXED Reality News |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Zlatev |first=Daniel |title=Sony developed PSVR2 for a PlayStation 5 cable connection as it warns original VR games will be difficult to port |url=https://www.notebookcheck.net/Sony-developed-PSVR2-for-a-PlayStation-5-cable-connection-as-it-warns-original-VR-games-will-be-difficult-to-port.675751.0.html |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=Notebookcheck |language=en}}</ref>

The PS VR2 has dual [[OLED]] panel with a [[4K resolution|4K]] [[display resolution]] and 90 Hz/120 Hz frame rate.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Lang |first=Ben |date=2022-02-04 |title=PSVR 2 Product Page Reveals New Details on Optics & Displays |url=https://www.roadtovr.com/psvr-2-product-page-fresnel-lens-dual-display/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=Road to VR |language=en-US}}</ref> Each display has a resolution of 2,000 x 2,040 pixels.<ref name=":0" /> The display also supports [[High dynamic range|HDR]].<ref name=":0" />

The headset uses [[Fresnel lens|fresnel]] lenses.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lang |first=Ben |date=2022-02-04 |title=PSVR 2 Product Page Reveals New Details on Optics & Displays |url=https://www.roadtovr.com/psvr-2-product-page-fresnel-lens-dual-display/ |access-date=2023-02-19 |website=Road to VR |language=en-US}}</ref> These lenses "act on microscopic level to significantly reduce ghosting" and "allow for a beautiful image without sacrificing brightness".<ref name=":4">{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Headset Teardown Video - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYhngu66Ccc&t=8m24s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Danneberg |first=Benjamin |date=2023-02-05 |title=Playstation VR 2 Hands-on: 8 pros, 3 cons & a question |url=https://mixed-news.com/en/playstation-vr-2-hands-on/ |access-date=2023-02-19 |website=MIXED Reality News |language=en-US}}</ref>

Compared to the first generation PS VR, the headset overall weight has been reduced,<ref name=":0" /> while the headband underwent many design improvements to increase its comfort.<ref>{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Headset Teardown Video - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYhngu66Ccc&t=530s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-20}}</ref> The [[Field of view|FOV]] was also increased to approx. 110 degrees.<ref name=":0" />

Unlike the first generation PlayStation VR, which tracked player movements through an external [[PlayStation Camera]], the PS VR2 tracks movements by four cameras mounted on the headset.<ref name=":0" /> The headset tracking cameras are also used to track the controllers,<ref name=":3" /> and to give video feed for the "see-through view" feature, which allows the user to view their surroundings without needing to take off the headset.<ref name=":0" />

The headset also has two inward-facing [[Infrared camera|IR cameras]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=PS VR2 Tech Specs {{!}} PlayStation VR2 display, setup and compatibility |url=https://www.playstation.com/en-us/ps-vr2/ps-vr2-tech-specs/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=PlayStation |language=en-US}}</ref> It is used for [[Eye tracking|eye-tracking]] to enable games to utilize [[foveated rendering]], a performance optimization technique where the render resolution of the game is reduced in areas where the player is not looking.<ref name="cnet hands on" /> The eye-tracking can also be used for other purposes, like providing an additional input method for the game with a simple look in a specific direction.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-02 |title=Eye-tracking firm confirms Sony has licensed its tech for PSVR2 |url=https://www.videogameschronicle.com/news/eye-tracking-firm-confirms-sony-has-licensed-its-tech-for-psvr2/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=VGC |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |title=Innovative Gameplay Features {{!}} PS VR2 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0c8lJkh72I |language=en |access-date=2023-02-14}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |title=Feel a New Real {{!}} PS VR2 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u5L9Mvh7tAk |language=en |access-date=2023-02-14}}</ref>

PS VR2 has a new lens adjustment dial, which allows the headset to accommodate different [[Inter-pupillary distance|IPD]] measurements.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-05 |title=Sony PSVR 2 hands-on: A massive jump forward from the original |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/sony-psvr-2-hands-on-3262865/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=Android Authority |language=en}}</ref> The lightshield of the headset was also designed to be able to accommodate different head shapes and nose sizes,<ref>{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Headset Teardown Video - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYhngu66Ccc&t=80s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-20}}</ref> and it can be removed from the PS VR2 headset to get cleaned using water.<ref name=":0" />

PS VR2 also features a headset feedback through a built-in [[Electric motor|motor]], which provides subtle haptic effects for added immersion, such as feeling the character's heartbeat or feeling the rush of objects passing close to the head.<ref name=":0" /> Some sources have pointed out that Sony have previously registered patents which mentioned using haptics to reduce motion sickness.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Jones |first=John-Paul |title=Ambitious PSVR 2 Patents Detail Motion Sickness Reduction, Full Body Tracking |url=https://www.psu.com/news/ambitious-psvr-2-patents-detail-motion-sickness-reduction-full-body-tracking/ |access-date=2023-02-17 |website=PlayStation Universe |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Meo |first=Francesco De |date=2021-08-04 |title=PSVR 2 To Feature Fresnel OLED Screens With a 2000x2040 Resolution, HDR Display; Release Plans to Be Revealed in Early 2022 - Rumor |url=https://wccftech.com/psvr-2-fresnel-oled-hdr/ |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=Wccftech |language=en-US}}</ref>

Additionally, PS VR2 headset has a cooling system that incorporates a duct and a small fan to cool the onboard [[IC chip]].<ref name=":12">{{Citation 
|title=PS VR2 Headset Teardown Video - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYhngu66Ccc&t=260s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-20}}</ref> In addition to cooling the IC chip, this airflow also provides [[Ventilation (architecture)|ventilation]] to help minimize the lenses fogging up while the player is wearing the headset.<ref name=":12" /><ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-02-22 |title=First look: the headset design for PlayStation VR2 |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2022/02/22/first-look-the-headset-design-for-playstation-vr2/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref>

The headset has built-in microphone and stereo headphone 2 in 1 3.5{{Nbsp}}mm jack.<ref name=":0" /> Using the PS5 Tempest 3D AudioTech, the headset supports [[3D audio effect|3D audio]] through headphones, while also allowing the in-game audio to dynamically adapt to the user position and head movements.<ref>{{Cite web |title=PlayStation®VR2 {{!}} The next generation of VR gaming on PS5 |url=https://www.playstation.com/en-us/ps-vr2/ |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=PlayStation |language=en-US}}</ref>

PS VR2 introduces the new Sense controllers.<ref name=":3" /> The controller was designed with a focus on balancing the [[center of gravity]] and reducing weight, while also maintaining comfort and incorporating new features.<ref>{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Sense Controller Teardown - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nYN98lMbyDE&t=307s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-20}}</ref> The controller is shaped like an "orb or hollowed-out sphere", which is used to ideally place a ring of 14 [[Infrared lamp|IR LEDs]] that is used for tracking its position and orientation.<ref name=":2">{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Sense Controller Teardown - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nYN98lMbyDE&t=53s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Jay |date=2023-02-15 |title=Sony's PSVR2 teardowns reveal how the headset tracks the Sense controllers |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/2/14/23600295/sony-playstation-vr2-psvr2-teardowns-headset-sense-controller |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}}</ref> The controller has several features, including key features from the [[DualSense]] controller, like haptic feedback and the adaptive triggers technology.<ref name=":3" /> Another new feature is the finger touch detection, which can detect the approximate location of the fingers, enabling the user to make more natural gestures during gameplay.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":3" /> This is achieved by using five [[Capacitive sensing|capacitive finger touch sensors]] on each controller (four sensors for each button, and one sensor for the analog stick) to detect the placements of the thumb, index, and the middle finger.<ref>{{Citation |title=PS VR2 Sense Controller Teardown - First Look with Engineers Behind the Next-Gen Hardware |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nYN98lMbyDE&t=167s |language=en |access-date=2023-02-20}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite web |date=2021-03-18 |title=Next-gen VR on PS5: the new controller |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2021/03/18/next-gen-vr-on-ps5-the-new-controller/ |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Harradence |first=Michael |title=PSVR 2 Finger Tracking Is Already Looking Extremely Promising In New Video |url=https://www.psu.com/news/psvr-2-finger-tracking-is-already-looking-extremely-promising-in-new-video/ |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=PlayStation Universe |language=en-US}}</ref>

Similar to the original PS VR, the new PS VR2 also features a Social Screen, which allows others to see what the player is experiencing in a 2D format on a TV screen.<ref name=":0" /> Cinematic Mode is also supported, which is used to view all non-VR game and media contents on a virtual cinema screen.<ref name=":0" />

The play area for PS VR2 can be customized using the cameras and the Sense controller.<ref name=":0" /> There are three different "VR Play Styles" depending on the game content and compatibility: Sitting, standing or roomscale (the last one allowing more movement while playing).<ref name=":0" />

==Games and content==
{{main|List of PlayStation VR2 games}}
More than 500 games are in development for PS VR2 according to Sony,<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Citation |title=PlayStation VR2 Sizzle Reel {{!}} 114 PSVR2 Games in Just 6 Minutes! |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xGuP98hbYPM |language=en |access-date=2023-02-19}}</ref> with more than 100 games available at the launch window,<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-21 |title=10 new PS VR2 titles revealed, launch window lineup now over 100 games |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2023/02/21/10-new-ps-vr2-titles-revealed-launch-window-lineup-now-over-100-games/ |access-date=2023-02-22 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref> including ''[[Resident Evil Village]]'', ''[[The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners – Chapter 2: Retribution]]'', ''[[Five Nights at Freddy's: Help Wanted 2]]'', ''[[No Man's Sky]]'', ''[[Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge]]'', ''[[Demeo]]'', ''[[Moss (video game)|Moss]]'' and ''[[Moss: Book II]]'' remasters, and PS VR2 exclusives ''[[Horizon Call of the Mountain]]'' and ''[[The Dark Pictures: Switchback VR]]''.<ref>{{Cite web |title=PS VR2 announced games |url=https://www.playstation.com/ps-vr2/games/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=PlayStation |language=en-US}}</ref> ''[[Gran Turismo 7]]'' and ''[[Beat Saber]]'' have also been updated to work with PS VR2.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Galloway |first=Ryan |date=2023-01-05 |title=Gran Turismo 7, Beat Saber, and more than 30 other games set for PSVR2 lineup |url=https://dotesports.com/general/news/gran-turismo-7-beat-saber-and-more-than-30-other-games-set-for-psvr2-lineup |access-date=2023-01-05 |website=Dot Esports |language=en-US}}</ref>

''Gran Turismo 7'' was also confirmed to have a full game support on the PS VR2 (except for the 2-player splitscreen mode).<ref name=":11">{{Cite web |date=2023-01-19 |title=PlayStation VR2: 13 new titles and launch lineup revealed |url=https://blog.playstation.com/2023/01/19/playstation-vr2-13-new-titles-and-launch-lineup-revealed/ |access-date=2023-02-17 |website=PlayStation.Blog |language=en-US}}</ref> This is in contrast to the previous game in the series, ''[[Gran Turismo Sport]]'', which was only supported by the original PS VR headset in a very limited capacity.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Evans |first=Andrew |date=2023-01-19 |title=Gran Turismo 7 Will Have (Almost) Full PlayStation VR2 Support |url=https://www.gtplanet.net/gt7-full-psvr2-support-20230119/ |access-date=2023-02-17 |website=GTPlanet |language=en-US}}</ref>

PS VR2 is not compatible with the [[List of PlayStation VR games|previous generation PS VR games]].<ref name=":0" /> Sony said that due to the differences in both the controller tracking hardware and the image rendering principle, [[porting]] games from the previous hardware would not be easy.<ref name=":5"/><ref>{{Cite web |author1=Michael L. Hicks |date=2023-02-19 |title=The PS VR2 isn't backwards compatible, but these PSVR games will get an upgrade |url=https://www.androidcentral.com/gaming/virtual-reality/is-ps-vr2-backward-compatible-with-psvr-games |access-date=2023-02-20 |website=Android Central |language=en}}</ref> It was later reported that many developers are working to upgrade their PS VR games for the PS VR2 system.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-01-24 |title=More than just ports: VR devs on bringing PSVR 1 titles to PSVR 2 |url=https://www.gamesindustry.biz/more-than-just-ports-vr-devs-on-bringing-psvr-1-titles-to-psvr-2 |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=GamesIndustry.biz |language=en}}</ref>

According to multiple sources, during a Sony developers conference, Sony told the developers that it wants to focus on "hybrid" VR games for the upcoming headset, much like the PSVR-optional games such as ''[[Hitman 3]], [[Resident Evil 7: Biohazard]]'' and ''No Man's Sky''.<ref>{{Cite web |author1=Connor Sheridan |date=2021-08-05 |title=PSVR 2 will reportedly aim for 'hybrid' games like Resident Evil 7 and Hitman 3 |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/psvr-2-will-reportedly-aim-for-hybrid-games-like-resident-evil-7-and-hitman-3/ |access-date=2023-02-15 |website=gamesradar |language=en}}</ref>

==Reception==
Early previews have been positive.<ref name="Verge Preview" /> Pre-release reviews were mostly positive, lauding the many improvements over its predecessor and its advanced technology.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Moss |first=Gabriel |date=2023-02-16 |title=PlayStation VR2 Review |url=https://www.ign.com/articles/playstation-vr2-review |access-date=2023-02-20 |website=IGN |language=en}}</ref> The lack of backward compatibility and the price of the headset received mixed reaction.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Borman |first=Max |date=2022-09-22 |title=PSVR 2 Not Being Backward Compatible with PSVR is a Disservice |url=https://gamerant.com/psvr-2-sony-no-backwards-compatibility-bad-inconvenience-game-preservation-problem/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=Game Rant |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |author1=Dustin Bailey |date=2022-11-02 |title=VR enthusiasts love the PSVR 2 price - everyone else hates it |url=https://www.gamesradar.com/vr-enthusiasts-love-the-psvr-2-price-everyone-else-hates-it/ |access-date=2022-11-30 |website=gamesradar |language=en}}</ref> Various game developers praised the capabilities of the headset, particularly in combination with the Playstation 5.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Greer |first=Jordan |date=2023-02-05 |title=Gran Turismo 7 Was Built for PSVR 2 From Day One, Says Kazunori Yamauchi |url=https://www.gtplanet.net/gt7-built-for-psvr2-from-day1-20230205/ |access-date=2023-02-12 |website=GTPlanet |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Square |first=Push |date=2023-02-06 |title=PS5's PSVR2 Outperforming Monster PC Rigs, Is the Pinnacle of Virtual Reality |url=https://www.pushsquare.com/news/2023/02/ps5s-psvr2-outperforming-monster-pc-rigs-is-the-pinnacle-of-virtual-reality |access-date=2023-02-12 |website=Push Square |language=en-GB}}</ref> The new Sense controllers received acclaim from [[CNET]],<ref name="cnet hands on" /> while [[Eurogamer]] singled out the HDR OLED screen for its brightness and contrast, stating that "it now feels more comparable to a proper high-end OLED TV".<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-02-16 |title=Sony PlayStation VR2: the Digital Foundry hardware review |language=en-gb |work=Eurogamer.net |url=https://www.eurogamer.net/digitalfoundry-2023-sony-playstation-vr2-the-digital-foundry-hardware-review |access-date=2023-02-16}}</ref> Some reviewers criticized the inconvenience of the wired connection.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tassi |first=Paul |title=PSVR 2 Is The Wrong Device, At The Wrong Time, At The Wrong Price |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/paultassi/2023/01/31/psvr-2-is-the-wrong-device-at-the-wrong-time-at-the-wrong-price/ |access-date=2023-02-16 |website=Forbes |language=en}}</ref> While the launch library was described as "solid" by [[CNN]],<ref>{{Cite web |last=Garrett |first=Ural |date=2023-02-16 |title=Sony's PlayStation VR 2 is a big improvement — but is it worth $550? |url=https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/playstation-vr-2 |access-date=2023-02-17 |website=CNN Underscored |language=en}}</ref> ''[[The Telegraph (London)|The Telegraph]]'' had some concerns about future first party software plans beyond the current offering.<ref name=":10">{{Cite news |last=Silver |first=Dan |date=2023-02-16 |title=PSVR2 review: PlayStation's next gen virtual reality tech is expensive, inessential… and exceptionally good |language=en-GB |work=The Telegraph |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/gaming/features/psvr2-review-specs-cinematic-mode-price/ |access-date=2023-02-16 |issn=0307-1235}}</ref>

On [[Metacritic]], out of 51 professional critic reviews, 14 were in the "Extremely positive" category, 33 in the "Positive" category, 4 in the "Mixed" category, and 0 in the "Negative" category.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hardware Review: PlayStation VR2 |url=https://www.metacritic.com/feature/playstation-vr2-headset-reviews |access-date=2023-02-18 |website=Metacritic |language=en}}</ref>

In regard to the software, previews of the exclusive title ''Gran Turismo 7'' were positive, with [[Motorsport.com]] describing it as "the best console virtual reality experience to date".<ref>{{Cite web |title=Hands-on: Why Gran Turismo 7 is a must-have PSVR2 title |url=https://www.motorsport.com/gaming/news/hands-on-why-gran-turismo-7-is-a-must-have-psvr2-title/10427283/ |access-date=2023-02-12 |website=www.motorsport.com |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |title=Gran Turismo 7 VR Is Incredible |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fpnvFGObiKQ |language=en |access-date=2023-02-12}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Greer |first=Jordan |date=2023-02-02 |title=Gran Turismo 7 in PSVR2: New Footage and Hands-On First Impressions |url=https://www.gtplanet.net/gran-turismo-7-in-psvr2-new-footage-and-hands-on-first-impressions/ |access-date=2023-02-12 |website=GTPlanet |language=en-US}}</ref>

XR Games and Sony Pictures VR took home Best in Gaming and Best in the World (across all categories) for the VR Shooter Zombieland: Headshot Fever Reloaded at The Australian XR Festival Awards 2023. <ref>https://www.animationxpress.com/games/sony-pictures-vr-and-xr-games-win-big-at-australian-xr-festival-awards-2023/</ref>
